original: Microsoft Silverlight is an open-source development tool that is used for creating and deploying interactive user experiences, internet applications and media experiences for web and mobile application.
result: Microsoft Silverlight is a tool used for developing and deploying interactive internet and mobile applications, as well as media experiences. It is an open-source development tool that provides users with a platform for creating engaging and immersive user experiences.

original: Yes. Silverlight is compatible with multiple browsers, devices and operating systems. It is a free plug-in, powered by .Net framework.
result: Yes, Silverlight works with various web browsers, devices, and operating systems. It is a plug-in that utilizes the .Net framework and is offered for free.

original: XAML language is used to design the layout of Silverlight. XAML stands for Extensible Application Markup Language. It is a declarative XML-based language created by Microsoft.
result: Silverlight employs a language named XAML to create its interface design. XAML, which stands for Extensible Application Markup Language, is an XML-based declarative language developed by Microsoft.

original: The tool used with the Silverlight application is the Microsoft Visual Studio. The applications are written in .NET language. So, all the associated tools with the .NET language will also work with the Silverlight as well. Microsoft Expression Blend is the tool that is used to develop and design the Silverlight user interface applications. Visual studio is the platform that is used to debug the Silverlight errors and use error free applications. Silverlight usually come in the zip format and it contains the .XAP format that consists of one or more .NET managed assemblies that are stored in .DLL files. It also consists of AppManifest.XAML that contains the entry point including the important classes and assemblies.
result: The Microsoft Visual Studio is the primary tool used with Silverlight applications. Developers write applications in the .NET language and use all of the associated tools that come with it. Microsoft Expression Blend is a specialized tool for designing and developing the user interface of Silverlight applications. Debugging errors and ensuring that applications run smoothly is typically done using Visual Studio. Silverlight applications are packaged as a zip file, which contains a .XAP file that includes one or more .NET managed assemblies stored as .DLL files. Additionally, the AppManifest.XAML file contains the entry point and essential classes and assemblies for the application.

original: Embedded Common Language Runtime (CLR)
result: The embedded common language runtime (CLR) is a software component that enables applications to run managed code within native applications. This technology allows for seamless integration of Microsoft's .NET platform with existing legacy applications and systems. It enables developers to write code using one language and have it execute in a variety of environments, making it easier to maintain and reuse software components. By embedding the CLR, applications gain access to a wide range of features and capabilities, such as automatic memory management, just-in-time compilation, and enhanced security.
